Help:Node.title: General Concepts: Emotion
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Emotions
Important Commands: applaud, bow, frown, gasp, grin, laugh, pout, shiver, smirk, yelp
Syntax: "smile sweetly", "bow grandly", "playfully wink"
To utilize actions and demonstrate emotion without the use of speech, verbs and adverbs are available in Skotos games and Theatres. A list of over 1500 verbs and 1800 adverbs allows movement, gestures, and signs of emotion.
Use verbs to convey mood and emotion. Some typical emotive verbs are: $(udat.chatchar)LAUGH, $(udat.chatchar)GRIN, $(udat.chatchar)POUT, and $(udat.chatchar)FROWN. Other verbs allow you to react to your surroundings or other characters, such as "$(udat.chatchar)SHIVER, $(udat.chatchar)GASP, $(udat.chatchar)APPLAUD, and $(udat.chatchar)YELP.
Adverbs may also be used with verbs. One might $(udat.chatchar)BOW SLOPPILY or $(udat.chatchar)SMIRK PLAYFULLY to convey action above and beyond the norm. This adds personal flavor to the action and demonstrates a specific emotion.
Players familiar with MUSHes should note that most of Skotos' games and Theatres do not have an "emote" command. It has been replaced with the huge Skotos vocabulary.
See Also: Adverbs, Communicate, Gesture
